activities.loc: Waushara Co. Courthouse 2nd Floor Room 230, Branch 1

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called @ 9:16 AM: Defendant Franklin R. Stapleman in court. Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. The Court questions the DE regarding counsel. DE has reached out to SPD to determine eligibility. The Court will adjourn the hearing for today to allow SPD to determine eligiblity. If the DE is found not eligible and wishes to have court appointed counsel an initial deposit of $250 is required by end of business on October 21, 2022 and monthly $100 payments to commence on December 1, 2022. STC scheduled - NOH given.
Status conference scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Status conference on December 6, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Voluntary appearance on October 13, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Letter to Court from the Defendant regarding missed appearance on 10/5/2022 - VA scheduled - Warrant Withdrawn

9:52 AM Defendant Franklin R. Stapleman not in court.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Based on non appearance the Court authorizes the issuance of a warrant extraditable within the Continental US.

Case called @ 11:02 AM Defendant Franklin R. Stapleman in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by the Court regarding withdrawal of counsel. DE advises he will be privately retaining counsel. STC scheduled - NOH given.
Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Plea/sentencing hearing on August 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Case called @ 1:55 PM Defendant Franklin R. Stapleman in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein in court for Franklin R. Stapleman. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. The Court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - reading waived. NGP entered. Motion for modification of bond filed by Atty Blankschein. The Court respectfully declines bond modification at this time.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 02:25 pm.
Status conference on April 25, 2022 at 02:25 pm.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond
Cash Bond Signed - $500 - 3/8/2022

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:15 PM Defendant Franklin R. Stapleman appeared, in custody, appears by video with Attorney Emma K Blankschein. Attorney Matthew R. Leusink appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. Bond argument by DA Leusink. Court orders $500 Cash Bond.   IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
Initial appearance scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
